data.name: How many workers are needed
data.description:
## Instruction We have to dig a pit and will like to know the number of workers that will be needed to complete the job within a day. The dimensions of the pit will be given as an object and the unit of measurement can be any of metres `m`, centimetres `cm` or millimetres `mm`. A pit with dimensions `length = 300m`, `width = 1000cm`, and `height = 1070mm` will be given as `{length:{value:300, unit:'m'}, width:{value:1000, unit:'cm'}, height:{value:1070, unit:'mm'}}`. There will be various categories of workers which you can select from with their corresponding capabilities of digging in `volume/day`. The unit can be any of cubic metre `m^3`, cubic centimetre `cm^3` or cubic millimetre `mm^3` (the per day will be omitted from the unit). For instance, if you have three categories of workers `a`, `b`, and `c` to select from and category `a` has 8 members who can each dig 400 cubic metres per day and category `b` has 20 members who can each dig 2,000,000 cubic centimetres per day, and category `c` has 10 members who can dig 1,000,000,000 cubic millimetre per day this will be given as `{a:{value:400, unit:"m^3", number: 8}, b:{value:2000000, unit:"cm^3", number: 20}, c:{value:1000000000, unit:"mm^3", number: 10}}`. You are to return the `optimal` number of workers that will be required. That is, you have to make sure you use the maximum number possible of workers with higher capabilities before moving to workers will lower capabilities. But if the work to be done is too small even for a worker with the lowest capability, you have to use a single worker from the lowest capability to complete the work. ## Example ### First Example For instance,if you have to do 3210m3 of work and have workers `{a:{value:400, unit:"m^3", number: 8}, b:{value:1000000000, unit:"mm^3", number: 10}, c:{value:2000000, unit:"cm^3", number: 20}}`. You will first consider using category `a` workers since they have higher capabilities of 400m3. All 8 of them can do 8x400 = 3200m3. 10m3 left to be done. The next category of worker is category `c` (they can do 2000000cm3 = 2m3 as against `b`'s 1000000000mm3 = 1m3). So you will need 5 more `c` workers to complete the 10m3. So your answer will be `{a:8,c:5}` ### Second Example BUT if you have to do 5m3 of work and have workers `{a:{value: 10, unit: 'm^3', number: 5},b{value: 6, unit: 'm^3', number: 4}}`, your answer will be `{b:1}` and not `{a:1}` ## Important Your result should be an object in the format of `{category of worker: number needed, category of worker: number needed,...}`. e.g. if you need 8 people from categoty `a` and 5 people from category `b` and nobody from category `c`, your answer will be `{a:8,b:5}` (If a category of work is not needed, it should not be included in the result). Note:
  1. The job must be finished in a day
  2. No work should be left undone
  3. There is no fractional person. A person should be either 1 or 0

    That is, if I have to do 5m3 of work and a category of worker that can do 2m3/day. I won't need 2.5 people, I will rather need 3 people.

  4. All presented workers will always be able to finish the work in a day.
  5. When no work is to be done, an empty object should be returned
  6. No two group of worker will have the same digging capability.
